snippet: Months after an appellate court ruled in favor of day laborers soliciting work from the sidewalk, ordinances to make doing so illegal are still in place across California.
abstract: Editorial observes that ordinances making it illegal for day laborers to solicit work from the sidewalk remain on the books in more than 50 municipalities across California, despite fact that similar ordinance was ruled unconstitutional by federal appeals court; maintains immigration hard-liners who are criminalizing act of looking for work are not only being cruel and counterproductive, but are also putting themselves on the wrong side of law.
